jx.jx_en_mean: better (or worse) than is usual or expected
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在一般水平以上（或以下）

lj.lj_ly: poor nutrition can leave you feeling below par.
lj.lj_ls: 营养不良能使你感到健康状态不佳。

jx.jx_en_mean: equal in importance or quality to; on an equal level with

lj.lj_ly: this home cooking is on a par with the best in the world.
lj.lj_ls: 这种自家的烹调和世界上最好的一样。

jx.jx_en_mean: what is normal or expected in any given circumstances
jx.jx_cn_mean: 正常的（事）；意料之中的（事）

lj.lj_ly: given the high standards of the food, the prices seem par for the course.
lj.lj_ls: 鉴于食物的高质量，这样的价格也是意料之中的事。

jx.jx_en_mean: at an expected or usual level or quality
jx.jx_cn_mean: 达到期望的水平（或质量）的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'equality of value or standing'): from Latin, equal', also equality'. The golf term dates from the late 19th cent

entry.def: If you say that two people or things are on a par with each other, you mean that they are equally good or bad, or equally important.

example.ex: Parts of Glasgow are on a par with the worst areas of London and Liverpool for burglaries.
example.tran: 格拉斯哥部分地区的入室盗窃案与伦敦、利物浦最乱的地区一样猖狂。

entry.def: In golf, par is the number of strokes that a good player should take to get the ball into a hole or into all the holes on a particular golf course.

example.ex: He was five under par after the first round.
example.tran: 第一轮过后，他低于标准杆5杆。

entry.tran: 不符合标准的；不如预期的
entry.def: If you say that someone or something is below par or under par, you are disappointed in them because they are below the standard you expected.

example.ex: Duffy's primitive guitar playing is well below par...
example.tran: 达菲粗糙的吉他演奏技巧远不够水平。

example.ex: A teacher's job is relatively safe, even if they perform under par in the classroom.
example.tran: 教师的职业相对稳定，即使他们的课上得不怎么好。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is not up to par, you are disappointed in them because they are below the standard you expected.

example.ex: His performance was not up to par...
It's a constant struggle to try to keep them up to par.
example.tran: 要让他们达标，需要不断努力。

entry.tran: 不在状态；感觉不如平常好
entry.def: If you feel below par or under par, you feel tired and unable to perform as well as you normally do.

entry.tran: （不快之事）不出所料，在意料之中
entry.def: If you say that something that happens is par for the course, you mean that you are not pleased with it but it is what you expected to happen.

example.ex: He said long hours are par for the course.
example.tran: 他说时间之久是意料之中的。

means.word_mean: 1. (golf) the standard number of strokes set for each hole on a golf course, or for the entire course;
2. a state of being essentially equal or equivalent; equally balanced;
1. make a score (on a hole) equal to par

auth_sentence.content: But that's par for the fashion show course.
auth_sentence.res_content: But that's par for the fashion show course.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But that's par for the fashion show course.

auth_sentence.content: Following politics is on par with following celebrity news.
auth_sentence.res_content: Following politics is on par with following celebrity news.

abbreviation.mean_cn: 精密进场雷达，准确接近雷达

sentences.cn: 你的股金与票面价值相等。

means.word_mean: 不够标准；不太好；不及平常(或预期的)好

sentences.en: I’ve been feeling rather below par recently—I think it’s time I took a holiday.
sentences.cn: 我最近一直感觉不太好，我想我需要休假。

sentences.en: His performance at the concert was well under par.
sentences.cn: 他在音乐会上的演奏大失水准。

sentences.en: He doesn’t think his salary is on a par with his position in the company.
sentences.cn: 他觉得自己的工资与在公司里的地位不相符。

sentences.en: As actors, I would say they were on a par.
sentences.cn: 作为演员来讲，我觉得他们不相上下。

means.word_mean: 意料之中；没什么不寻常

sentences.en: ‘The food on this plane is terrible.’ ‘Well, that’s about par for the course.’
sentences.cn: “这飞机上的食物太糟糕了。”“是啊，不过这不足为奇。”

means.word_mean: 达到/超过标准(或质量等)

sentences.en: You don’t need to worry. Your work is well above par.
sentences.cn: 不用担心，你的工作做得相当不错。

sentences.en: His driving wasn’t quite up to par and he lost the race.
sentences.cn: 他的驾驶技术不够好，因此输掉了比赛。
